definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: These substances leak from the rusty barrels and pollute soil.
sentences.chinese: 这些物质从生锈的桶中渗出然后污染了土壤。

sentences.english: The white juice oozes out the sides.
sentences.chinese: 白色的汁液从边上渗出来。

sentences.english: See, from my dead lips the ooze exuding at last.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，焦唇终于渗出软腻的细泥。

sentences.english: The miners stayed alive by drinking water that seeped through the earth and were in a stable condition, Wang said.
sentences.chinese: 三位矿工依靠地下不断渗出的水撑了下来，王说。

sentences.english: I found that depression and worry oozed out of my system with the sweat .
sentences.chinese: 我发现忧郁和烦恼能随着汗水一起渗出我的机体。

sentences.english: A fetid odor seeps from the walls, the odor of a mildewed mattress.
sentences.chinese: 墙里渗出一股恶臭味，那是发霉的床垫味。

sentences.english: Fuel was seeping through the joints, raining down on the hangar floor.
sentences.chinese: 燃料从接缝渗出，雨点般落到机棚地上。

sentences.english: Black oil was oozing out of the engine.
The purulent exudate with some hemorrhage is seen at the right in the abscess center.
sentences.chinese: 右侧脓肿中央可见伴出血的脓性分泌物渗出。

sentences.english: What calls erythema oozy sex gastritis ?
sentences.chinese: 什么叫红斑渗出性胃炎？

sentences.english: This exudate gives rise to the productive cough of purulent yellow sputum seen with bacterial pneumonias.
sentences.chinese: 渗出引起咳脓性黄痰，如细菌性肺炎。

sentences.english: Sweat exudes through the pores in the skin.
sentences.chinese: 汗从皮肤上的毛孔中渗出。

sentences.english: Piled beside the pool round, a small pond in the center spring water seepage.
sentences.chinese: 池边砌成圆形，池中心一小孔中有泉水渗出。

sentences.english: A thick yellow exudate coats the peritoneal surfaces.
sentences.chinese: 一层厚的黄色渗出物被覆在腹膜外。

sentences.english: Blood was still oozing from the wound.

definition: to let drip/to trickle down/to shed (tears)
wisps of blood/visible veins/(of eyes) bloodshot
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
